Name: Batida de Abacaxi
Ingredients: 15 ml Sugar syrup 'rich' (2 sugar to 1 water, 65.0°Brix)
Instructions: Select and pre-chill a Collins glass .
Review: This easy crowd pleaser is creamy, fruity and to taste - only vaguely alcoholic.
History: The Batida (meaning 'shake') is a traditional Brazilian drink and 'Abacaxi' means pineapple in Portuguese, the official language of Brazil. Batida is a broad term for a drink usually containing fresh fruit, sugar and/or sweetened condensed milk (leite condensado). They are often blended with crushed ice or shaken and served over crushed ice.
Nutrition: One serving of Batida de Abacaxi contains 273 calories
